subject: RE: [junit] TestCase#setUp
msgSnippet: This should help.  This example performs a one-time setup of mock data files before all tests run and a one-time teardown after all tests are run.  This is in
messageBody:
This should help. This example performs a one-time setup of mock data files
before all tests run and a one-time teardown after all tests are run. This
is in my AllTests class. Here's what I did (I don't remember where I found
this tip):

/**
* 'wrapper' wraps the test suite into a TestSetup object which overrides
the
* setUp() and tearDown() methods. This is a technique for use with JUnit
that
* wraps all of the tests with a one-time setup and teardown activity.
JUnit
* will run setUp() and tearDown() before and after each individual unit
test
* which is what I DON'T want to do here. I just want to build the fake
data
* files once to be used by any and all tests.
*/
public static Test suite ( ) {
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite("All UnitTestDemo Application
Tests");
suite.addTest( new TestSuite(TestTeam.class) );
/* add other testsuites to suite here */
TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup( suite ) {
public String dirpath = "";
public void setUp() {
dirpath = FileBroker.getDirPath();
FileBroker.setDirectoryPath( "C:\\temp\\" );
BuildDataFiles();
}
public void tearDown() {
RemoveDataFiles();
FileBroker.setDirectoryPath( dirpath );
}
};
return wrapper;
}

> Mike Duffy wrote:
>
> > When a class is added to a test suite and that test suite is run, it
> > seems strange to me that the method TestCase#setUp runs every time a
> > test method runs. So if you have twenty test methods in a class and
> > you add that class to a test suite, the method setUp runs twenty
> > times.
> >
> > Shouldn't the method setUp be run just once for all the methods in a
> > class? Is there some default setting that I missed?
